column4: how can i share folders wirelessly between two ubuntu computers?
system > Administration > shared Folders lets you share folders over a network
no gui - x won't start,
ah, okay.  Well, you can use samba for it.
I only ever share with windows.. but you don't need to include a windows box on the network for it to work
samba's pretty easy to configure through the command line
Well, for basic sharing it is.  I use it on a lan, so I don't worry too much about security.  Just basic username/password check.  No complaints
how to anywhere?
plenty.  I'm looking for the one I used when I first set it up.
thanks
I can't find the one I used, but I might be able to walk you through it if you don't need to do anything unusual
nah i just need files from a computer that's screwed over to a working ubuntu computer
ah.. and scp's no good?
scp?
it works like cp but across computers
sounds fine, does cp work with folders>
sure does.  If you specify a folder instead of a file, it'll copy the whole folder
sounds perfect
you'd need  to know the full path.. can't tab for the remote folders, I think.
http://czarism.com/easy-peasy-ubuntu-linux-nfs-file-sharing
http://www.shadlen.org/sl/linux/remote/scp.htm
